Kite boarding which might also be called kite surfing.. Kite boarding when combining with paragliding, windsurfing, skateboarding and gymnastics produces a great sport. kite boarding utilizes the concept of wind strength that applies a force against the mist and increase the risk for kite board to move on the water surface. The surfboard or kite board does not have any bindings such like foot straps, etc

The History of Kite boarding:

It was first conceptualized by George Pocock a New Zealand national in 1800 He used wooden carts and boards rather than working with a kiteboard, but used a four line controlling system which can be still active his intent in inventing skateboard was to introduce kite power rather than horse power First surfer got success in modeling lifting kites was Samuel Cody who crossed the English Channel with a canvas boat accelerated using a kite board.

The experiments conducted in this regard got much success in 1970's when the controllability of kite board was ably improved. In 1980's a lot many experiments were conducted and new combinations were tried with kite These developments were contemporary to the invention of ball socket swivel by Dieter Strassila which made kite boards to sail upstream and upwind. This also allowed the sailor to take off into the air at his willThe credit of first design of inflated kite goes to him for which he also holds patent rites.

Kite buggying was first started by Peter Lynn in 1990 He became a citizen of New Zealan Peter used a mix of Buggy with kite. This had become a trend and last till 2000s'Kite Ski' which was which includes a water skies and controlled by kite and bar along with a brake was patented By Bill Roseller along with his son in 1990 Kite ski was made available in 1994 for commercial purposes The kite had water launch capability to go upwind The ski can also be known as surf board or wake board.

Kite boarding got its status of mainstream sport in 1998 Many kite boarding sports competitions were organized by academic institutions at that time, first of these sports event happened at Maui, Hawai. It was in 1999 kite boarding idea was introduced and from 2001 onwards twin-bidirectional kite boards would be the most well-known kite boards.

Notable Journeys of Kite surfing

Traveling great distances with a kite board are possible, and lots of notable journeys made with a kite board are

In 2006, Kristy Jones wrote a record to his name by covering a distance of 225 km(140 miles) solo from Lanzarote towards Canary Islands, to Morocco within 9 hours

Rapheal Salles, Mark Blanc and Sylvain Maurain put in a feather on their caps by creating record of the mixture of speed and distance from Saint Tropez to Calvi

They took 5 hours and 30 minutes to cover 207kms The standard speed being 38 kms per hour

A long ski board journey record within the history is set by Phillip McCoy Midler that he completed taking Twenty four hours He travelled through South Padre Island, Texas to Matagorda, Texas covering a distance of 199.63 kilometers

wake styling, jumping, wake skating, course racing, and speed racing are some of the ski boarding styles.
